column5: Today, I went to Rice Lake with my brother and his friend to do a little fishing and when we arrived at Bewdley, we noticed that the water was like chocolate milk. I read something about how its hard catching bass in these type of conditions but I saw someone catching a bass, probably around 2lbs.  Right away, using our plastic Berkly honey worm, we managed to catch tons of perches by just reeling it slowly. I managed to catch around 25 perches, 10 of them were jumbos. Heres a picture of my biggest catch of the day. I know it's just a perch but at least I didn't get skunked.  Oh yeah there were a lot of Asian guys who made my day LOL. They celebrated very loudly when they caught a small fish while I was ride beside them just pulling in perch nonstop. I just love the feeling of out fishing people, it makes me look like a pro. I did not keep any of the fish since I'm a catch and release fishermen.
sounds like you had a good time,congrats
The fishing on Rice has been pretty good lately and the dark water is just the start of great fall fishing.  Looks like you had a great time.
Great post, Anatz.  I know that feeling too, about putting on a clinic for the poor pitied folks around me.  It happened once about 11 years ago...
